key_points: U.S. Congressman Thomas Massie posted a Christmas picture featuring himself and his family holding an array of guns.
The post came days after a school shooting in Michigan resulted in the deaths of four teenagers.
Massie's tweet included a caption wishing for ammunition from Santa.
The family picture included firearms resembling an M60 machine gun, AR-15 semi-automatic rifle, and a Thompson submachine gun.
Some of the guns in the photo are semi-automatic versions of weapons that are restricted to military and law enforcement or specially licensed civilians.
Ethan Crumbley, 15, was identified as the perpetrator of the school shooting, with his parents also arrested in connection.
Democratic U.S. Representative John Yarmuth criticized Massie's post for being insensitive after the shooting tragedy.
Yarmuth's reaction highlighted tensions over gun control and gun rights debates in the U.S.
Massie represents a solidly Republican district in Kentucky.
Jonathan van Norman, Massie's campaign manager, did not respond to comment requests.
spokespersons: Jonathan van Norman (Campaign Manager, Representative Thomas Massie)
John Yarmuth (U.S. Representative, Chair of the U.S. House of Representatives Budget Committee)
